page.lettertext:
fol.173r
July
S
r
Yo
r
last letters came to my hands weare of the x
th
of Julie, and an other of the next daie followinge. By both
w
ch
it did app eare that at the time of yo
r
writinge, yo
u
expected
the Rendringe of
Groninghen,
thowgh yo
w
cowld not certainelye
write the same: And yet yo
r
letters comminge to mee the xxv
th
of this monethe, the same daie my
L. of Essex
had letters from
the Campe, that the Towne was rendred, so as I dowbt not
but [knowe] after the writinge of yo
r
letters of the xj
th
yo
w
had
the certaintie.
[.]
Nowe uppon this service ended, it is likelie her
Ma
tie
will enter into
sum considerac
o
n for yo
r
further emploim
t
there w
th
the
States
: and
at this p
nt
hir Ma
tie
looketh to be satisfied w
th
a request made
to the States, for sum assistance unto hir Ma
tie
in the
s
rvice of
Britaigne
w
th
their Shippes: and other helpes towardes that
service, w
ch
trewelie is of as great importance as anie
thinge attempted by hir Ma
tie
thes late yeares./
Fr
o
Grenwych. 27 of Juli
1594
Your assured lo
v
fr
e
d William Burghley
